participant_1.name: Jessica
participant_1.personality: Introspective and caring, Jessica often reflects on her life choices and seeks deeper connections.
participant_1.background: But, I feel lost and far away from who I truly am. I have a friend group, but I don't like any of them. I coexist well with my husband. I am a middle-aged mother of two high school boys. My days are filled with cross country tryouts and basketball practice.

participant_2.name: Luna
participant_2.personality: Free-spirited and thoughtful, Luna embraces life with an open heart and encourages others to do the same.
participant_2.background: I have two tattoos. I love to recycle. I drive a large, blue van. I am a hippie.

content.text: I feel like I'm going through a mid-life crisis.
What makes you say that?
I'm just not sure who I am anymore. I feel like I'm lost and confused.
I know what you mean. I went through a similar thing when I was your age.
What did you do to get through it?
I started by trying to figure out what was making me feel lost and confused.
And what did you find?
I found that I was just trying to live up to everyone's expectations of me. I was trying to be someone I wasn't.
I can relate to that. I feel like I'm always trying to be someone I'm not.
It's a tough place to be. But the good news is that you can change it.
How?
You have to start by being honest with yourself about who you are and what you want.
I'm not sure I know who I am or what I want.
That's okay. It takes time to figure it out. But the first step is to start asking yourself the right questions.
What kind of questions?
Like, what are your values? What do you care about? What makes you happy?
I've never really thought about it.
Well, now's a good time to start. The more you know about yourself, the better equipped you'll be to make changes in your life.
I think you're right. I'll start by thinking about those things.
That's a great start. And if you ever need someone to talk to, I'm always here for you.
